title: Having trouble putting inputs in correct format
body:
Hello, thank you for your repository. I have been consistently getting a mAP score of 0% with no errors.

I have a set of 141 images/labels with instances of only one class called '0'. These are small features, around 10 x 10 in pixels, and my images are 1104x800 pixels.

This is what a line of my ground truth files looks like:
0 889 285 901 269
This is in the format the ReadMe indicated: <class> <left> <top> <right> <bottom> [<difficult>]
Nothing is marked as difficult.

This is what a line of my detection results files looks like:
0 0.252441 801 592 809 576
This is also in the format indicated in the ReadMe: <class> <confidence> <left> <top> <right> <bottom>

When I run the code, every single detection is a false positive, as indicated by the output.
![detection-results-info](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17585864/120905221-356d7480-c66e-11eb-89c8-50488b29d954.png)
![ground-truth-info](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17585864/120905224-369ea180-c66e-11eb-8adc-c25e6058a9c6.png)

I also tried the script where my class is named 'd' instead, with the same result. This is what a single detection looks like. I am not being able to tell if I have made a mistake labelling the ground-truth results or the detection-results.
![d_detection0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17585864/120905264-a2810a00-c66e-11eb-9973-3d4fa2efe9b9.jpg)


I have also attached whole label files.
[2019-06-04_s1_0700.txt](https://github.com/Cartucho/mAP/files/6603202/2019-06-04_s1_0700.txt)
[2019-06-04_s1_0700.txt](https://github.com/Cartucho/mAP/files/6603203/2019-06-04_s1_0700.txt)
